Introducing News Explorer: An Experiment in Human-AI CollaborationRyan Bubinski, Alexander Gusev3/7/2023

Decrypt launches a real-time feed of human and AI-generated breaking news summaries from around the web.

Our Company, journalism, OpenAI, artificial intelligence, AI, media, ChatGPT, NewsRead

font-normal text-lg md:text-xl md:leading-9 tracking-px text-body gg-dark:text-neutral-100"><span style="font-weight:400">With todays refresh of the </span><i><span style="font-weight:400">Decrypt</span></i><span style="font-weight:400"> homepage, you may have noticed the addition of a new section with a modest footprint: a human-curated feed of AI-summarized breaking news headlines generated from sources around the web. We call this feature the News Explorer.</span></p><p class="font-meta-serif-pro font-normal text-lg md:text-xl md:leading-9 tracking-px text-body gg-dark:text-neutral-100"><span style="font-weight:400">Its a small but important foray into the world of AI content curation and creation for </span><i><span style="font-weight:400">Decrypt</span></i><span style="font-weight:400">, and we think it's a great value-add for visitors to our homepage.</span></p><div class="post-content-w-full my-8 flex xl:hidden items-center justify-center"><div class="relative flex-none flex flex-col items-center justify-center" style="min-width:300px;min-height:250px"><div class="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center text-sm text-neutral-700 bg-neutral-50 opacity-75"><span>AD</span></div><div class="relative PubGeniusSlot_root__2r9C5 pubg-ad"></div></div></div><div class="post-content-w-full my-10 hidden xl:flex items-center justify-center"><div class="relative flex-none flex flex-col items-center justify-center" style="min-width:300px;min-height:250px"><div class="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center text-sm text-neutral-700 bg-neutral-50 opacity-75"><span>AD</span></div></div></div><p class="font-meta-serif-pro font-normal text-lg md:text-xl md:leading-9 tracking-px text-body gg-dark:text-neutral-100"><a href="https://www.niemanlab.org/2023/01/buzzfeed-will-start-using-ai-to-write-quizzes-and-other-content/?relatedstory" target="_blank" class="sc-adb616fe-0 ePvUAp"><span style="font-weight:400">Many</span></a> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/mar/01/german-publisher-axel-springer-says-journalists-could-be-replaced-by-ai" target="_blank" class="sc-adb616fe-0 ePvUAp"><span style="font-weight:400">publishers</span></a><span style="font-weight:400"> are now experimenting with the impressiveyet still far from perfectcapabilities of the latest generation of large language models and other AI tools. But as </span><span style="font-weight:400">many other publications <a href="https://www.niemanlab.org/2023/03/wired-tells-readers-what-it-will-use-generative-ai-for-and-whats-off-limits/" target="_blank" class="sc-adb616fe-0 ePvUAp">have noted</a></span><span style="font-weight:400">, its critical to be deliberate and methodical with these approaches.</span></p><p class="font-meta-serif-pro font-normal text-lg md:text-xl md:leading-9 tracking-px text-body gg-dark:text-neutral-100"><span style="font-weight:400">We believe the best and most ethical course of action here is one that combines measured introductions of AI with careful human oversight, to both catch and correct errors and provide valuable training data for fine-tuning our approach. </span></p><p class="font-meta-serif-pro font-normal text-lg md:text-xl md:leading-9 tracking-px text-body gg-dark:text-neutral-100"><span style="font-weight:400">Heres how it works on the back end: Our custom AI tool summarizes headlines and stories from news outlets weve added, and a </span><i><span style="font-weight:400">Decrypt</span></i><span style="font-weight:400"> editor checks them over for accuracy before publishing them to the News Explorer feed. Click any headline in the News Explorer and it will bring you to a <a href="https://decrypt.co/news-explorer" target="_blank" class="sc-adb616fe-0 ePvUAp">landing pag</a>e that has summaries of each story and a link to the source.</span></p><figure class="w-full max-w-full mt-4 overflow-hidden"><span readabilityObject.title: Introducing News Explorer: An Experiment in Human-AI Collaboration
readabilityObject.content:
With todays refresh of the Decrypt homepage, you may have noticed the addition of a new section with a modest footprint: a human-curated feed of AI-summarized breaking news headlines generated from sources around the web. We call this feature the News Explorer.

Its a small but important foray into the world of AI content curation and creation for Decrypt, and we think it's a great value-add for visitors to our homepage. 

Many publishers are now experimenting with the impressiveyet still far from perfectcapabilities of the latest generation of large language models and other AI tools. But as many other publications have noted, its critical to be deliberate and methodical with these approaches. 

We believe the best and most ethical course of action here is one that combines measured introductions of AI with careful human oversight, to both catch and correct errors and provide valuable training data for fine-tuning our approach.

Heres how it works on the back end: Our custom AI tool summarizes headlines and stories from news outlets weve added, and a Decrypt editor checks them over for accuracy before publishing them to the News Explorer feed. Click any headline in the News Explorer and it will bring you to a landing page that has summaries of each story and a link to the source.

News Explorer is an experiment in building tech tools that augment the capabilities of our talented staff.

If successful, we also hope it can serve as a foundation for Decrypt to pursue more ambitious projects and experiments in applying AI to media.

Stay on top of crypto news, get daily updates in your inbox.
